newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan overnight rates plunge before close.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan overnight rates plunge before close.

text.p: Pakistan's money market overnight rates plunged before the close on Tuesday on lending pressure, dealers said.
Despite Monday's close at 20 percent, early morning overnights were traded around 15 percent, one dealer at KASB & Co said.
The deals were later struck at 14 percent and then at 13.50 percent, 12.50 percent 10 percent and 8.00 percent, before closing at 3.00 percent on lending pressure, the dealer said.
The market easily squared itself, he said.
